name: Quetzalcoatl
description: Feathered serpent god, bringer of knowledge and culture.

name: Tezcatlipoca
description: God of night and sorcery, rival of Quetzalcoatl.

name: Huitzilopochtli
description: War and sun god, patron of the Mexica/Aztecs.

name: Tlaloc
description: Rain god, both feared and worshiped for floods and fertility.

name: Xipe Totec
description: Flayed god of renewal and fertility; worshipers wore flayed skins.

name: Mictecacihuatl
description: Lady of the Dead, ruler of Mictlan; linked to Día de los Muertos.

name: Coatlicue
description: Mother goddess wearing a skirt of serpents.

name: Coyolxauhqui
description: Moon goddess, defeated by Huitzilopochtli.

name: Chalchiuhtlicue
description: Goddess of rivers, seas, and storms, bringer of floods.

name: Xiuhtecuhtli
description: Lord of fire and time, central to New Fire ceremony.

name: Itzamna
description: Supreme creator god, associated with writing and medicine.

name: Ixchel
description: Moon goddess of fertility, childbirth, and weaving.

name: Ah Puch
description: Death god of the Maya, skeletal and fearsome.

name: Camazotz
description: Bat god of night and sacrifice, feared figure of Xibalba.

name: Dzahui
description: Rain god central to Mixtec religion.

name: Cociyo
description: Lightning and storm god, bringer of rain.

name: La Llorona
description: Weeping woman ghost who drowned her children and wanders riversides.

name: El Cucuy
description: Boogeyman-like figure who steals misbehaving children.

name: Charro Negro
description: Dark rider who offers riches at the cost of your soul.

name: Naguals
description: Humans who transform into animals (often jaguar or coyote).

name: Santa Muerte
description: Modern folk saint of death, revered for protection and miracles.

name: Niño Fidencio
description: 20th century healer venerated as a folk saint.

name: Chupacabra
description: Goat-sucking cryptid said to drain livestock.

name: Aluxes
description: Small trickster spirits that protect or harass humans.

name: Ahuizotl
description: Doglike water creature with hand on its tail, drags victims into water.

name: Tlanchana
description: Mermaid-like spirit with serpent lower body.

name: Tzitzimimeh
description: Star demons that devour people during solar eclipses.

name: Centzon Totochtin
description: 400 rabbit gods of drunkenness and festivity.

name: Tonatiuh
description: Sun god demanding human sacrifice.

name: Ehecatl
description: Aspect of Quetzalcoatl as the wind god.

name: Tzitzimitl
description: Skeletal star demon attacking during eclipses.

name: Tepoztécatl
description: God of pulque, associated with drunkenness.

name: Mayahuel
description: Goddess of maguey plant and pulque drink.

name: Ixtab
description: Mayan goddess of suicide, leading souls to paradise.

name: Horus
description: Horus is a deity from Egypt associated with sky, kingship. Linked to tempests and the rule of kings.

name: Set (Seth)
description: Set (Seth) is a deity from Egypt associated with storms, desert, strife. Linked to tempests and the rule of kings.

name: Ptah
description: Ptah is a deity from Egypt associated with crafts, creation by word.

name: Sobek
description: Sobek is a deity from Egypt associated with crocodiles, nile power.

name: Thoth
description: Thoth is a deity from Egypt associated with wisdom, writing.

name: Maat
description: Maat is a deity/principle from Egypt associated with truth, order, feather.

name: Mut
description: Mut is a deity from Egypt associated with mother goddess, vultures.

name: Hathor
description: Hathor is a deity from Egypt associated with joy, love, music, sky cow. Linked to tempests and the rule of kings.

name: Sekhmet
description: Sekhmet is a deity from Egypt associated with war, plague, healing.

name: Kebechet
description: Kebechet is a deity/spirit from Egypt associated with cooling waters, embalming. Appeased for safe passage and rains.

name: Nehebkau
description: Nehebkau is a deity/serpent from Egypt associated with protection, binding of ka.

name: Apophis (Apep)
description: Apophis (Apep) is a monster/serpent from Egypt associated with chaos serpent, night. Serpents mark thresholds and hidden wisdom.

name: Am-heh
description: Am-heh is a monster from Egypt associated with devourer, lake of fire. Appeased for safe passage and rains.

name: Maahes
description: Maahes is a deity from Egypt associated with lion warrior, storms. Linked to tempests and the rule of kings.

name: Qetesh (Qadesh)
description: Qetesh (Qadesh) is a deity/sync. from Egypt/Levant associated with love, fertility.

name: Anat (adopted)
description: Anat (adopted) is a deity/sync. from Egypt/Levant associated with war, hunt.

name: Ash (Oasis Lord)
description: Ash (Oasis Lord) is a deity from Egypt (Western Desert) associated with oases, libyan connections.

name: Andjety
description: Andjety is a deity from Egypt (Delta) associated with fertility, crook & flail.

name: Wosret
description: Wosret is a deity from Egypt (Thebes) associated with protection, strength.

name: Menhit
description: Menhit is a deity from Egypt (Nubia/Thebes) associated with war lioness, arrows.

name: Satis (Satet)
description: Satis (Satet) is a deity from Egypt (Elephantine) associated with cataracts, floods. Appeased for safe passage and rains.

name: Anuket (variant)
description: Anuket (variant) is a deity from Egypt (Elephantine) associated with speed of nile, gazelle.

name: Heryshaf (Herishef)
description: Heryshaf (Herishef) is a deity from Egypt (Heracleopolis) associated with ram lord, fertility.

name: Kherty
description: Kherty is a deity/spirit from Egypt associated with ferryman of the dead.

name: Tutu (Tithoes)
description: Tutu (Tithoes) is a deity/spirit from Egypt associated with apotropaic, sphinx-like.

name: Medjed
description: Medjed is a spirit from Egypt associated with blasting spirit, book of the dead.

name: Bat (Cow Goddess)
description: Bat (Cow Goddess) is a deity from Egypt associated with sistrum, stars.

name: Coyote
description: A central trickster in many tribes; a shapeshifter whose pranks and misdeeds teach moral lessons.

name: Raven
description: Creator and trickster who stole the sun and reshaped the world in many Northwest Coast traditions.

name: Nanabozho
description: Culture hero who names animals, shapes landscapes, and instructs humans through humor and wit.

name: Iktomi
description: A spider trickster whose foolishness and cunning both ensnare others and himself, teaching caution.

name: Glooskap
description: Creator/transformer who tamed monsters and taught people skills like hunting and governance.

name: Manitou
description: A pervasive spiritual power imbuing beings, places, and events; both personal and cosmic.

name: White Buffalo Calf Woman
description: Brought the sacred pipe and seven rites, promising renewal and balance for the people.

name: Deer Woman
description: A beautiful spirit with deer traits who punishes predatory or unfaithful men; a cautionary tale.

name: Thunderbird
description: Mighty sky being whose wingbeats make thunder; fights underwater monsters and protects people.

name: Underwater Panther (Mishipeshu)
description: A horned, feline serpentine water lord dwelling in deep lakes, feared and revered for its force.

name: Horned Serpent
description: A colossal horned snake associated with storms and the underworld; initiatory danger and knowledge.

name: Uktena
description: A vast horned serpent whose gaze kills; slaying it brings power but great peril.

name: Piasa Bird
description: A man eating winged monster recorded on Mississippi bluffs; a warning figure of the river.

name: Wendigo
description: Embodying insatiable hunger and greed, it haunts winter forests and tempts humans to cannibalism.

name: Spearfinger (U`tlunta)
description: Stone skinned crone with a knife finger who preys on children; defeated by trickery and community.

name: Raven Mocker
description: A feared night witch that steals the dying person’s heart and years; opposed by medicine people.

name: Nunnehi
description: Immortal spirit folk who aid the lost and brave; dwell in mountain passages and mounds.

name: Yunwi Tsunsdi
description: Small guardian folk who help or hinder families depending on respect and offerings.

name: Pukwudgie
description: Small forest beings armed with darts; can help the respectful but torment the arrogant.

name: Mannegishi
description: Trickster dwarf folk who live among rapids and boulders, waylaying travelers and canoes.

name: Flying Head
description: A giant disembodied head with fiery eyes and long hair; a nightmare born of taboo and famine.

name: Stone Giants
description: Cannibal ogres of the high places; heroes outwit them to save villages.

name: Sedna
description: Goddess of the sea whose fingers became marine life; shamans appease her to ensure hunting.

name: Qalupalik
description: Green skinned sea dweller who lures disobedient children; a cautionary shoreline tale.

name: Mahaha
description: A blue demon that tickles victims to death and leaves rictus smiles in the snow.

name: Amarok
description: A solitary giant wolf that hunts those who stray alone at night; a test of courage.

name: Tornit
description: A race of large, clumsy people at odds with Inuit; cautionary tales of theft and pride.

name: Adlet
description: Children of a human and dog; wanderers at the margins, embodying taboo transgression.

name: Kushtaka
description: Land otter shapeshifters who mimic voices to lure victims to watery fates—sometimes rescuers, often peril.

name: Kokopelli
description: Humpbacked flute player who brings fertility and mirth, traveling with seeds and stories.

name: Kachinas
description: Masked spirit intermediaries honored in ceremonies; teach ethics and balance with nature.

name: Spider Grandmother
description: Wise ancestress who weaves the world and guides heroes through trials.

name: Changing Woman (Asdzáá Nádlééhé)
description: Personification of life’s cycles who renews the world and grants hózhó (beauty/balance).

name: Skinwalker (Yee Naaldlooshii)
description: A witch who dons animal skins to become beasts; feared for malign magic and curses.

name: Dzunukwa (Tsonoqwa)
description: A wild woman of the woods whose basket bears away children; paradoxically a bringer of riches.

name: Br’er Rabbit
description: A clever rabbit who outwits stronger foes—an allegory of resilience under oppression.

name: High John the Conqueror
description: A spirit of triumph and freedom; his root is carried for courage, justice, and charm.

name: Boo Hag
description: A skinless witch who rides sleepers and steals vitality; red salt bricks keep her away.

name: Plat Eye
description: A malevolent shape shifting ghost said to guard hidden hoards and crossroads.

name: Crossroads Spirit
description: A liminal spirit who grants skill for a price; famed in blues lore at midnight crossroads.

name: Papa Legba
description: Opens the way and carries prayers; master of languages and thresholds.

name: Baron Samedi
description: Top hatted guardian of graves who heals or hexes with bawdy humor and iron justice.

name: Maman Brigitte
description: A fierce protector of the dead, often syncretized with Brigid; drinks spicy rum.

name: Ezili Dantor
description: A powerful, scarred mother spirit of justice and resilience; defender of the marginalized.

name: Ezili Freda
description: A refined spirit of romance and finery; demanding in offerings and protocol.

name: La Diablesse
description: A beautiful woman with a cloven hoof who lures cruel or arrogant men to doom.

name: Soucouyant
description: An old woman who sheds her skin to fly as a fireball and drink blood; salt traps her.

name: Duppy
description: Restless spirits that can harm or help; lime, salt, and nine night rites keep balance.

name: Rolling Calf
description: A demonic calf that roams roads rattling chains; a terror for wrongdoers.

name: Papa Bois
description: Bearded horned guardian of the forest who tests hunters’ respect for nature.

name: Headless Horseman
description: A spectral rider seeking his lost head; warns of pride and fear on dark roads.

name: Chasse Galerie (Flying Canoe)
description: Lumberjacks make a devil’s pact to fly home in a canoe; one slip breaks the spell.

name: Bonhomme Sept Heures
description: The 'Seven O’Clock Man' who snatches children out late; a parental warning tale.

name: Loup Garou
description: A Catholic tinged werewolf curse spread by sin or sorcery; prowls rural roads.

name: Rougarou
description: Cajun werewolf of the bayous who punishes oath breakers and Lent violators.

name: Sasquatch
description: A towering hairy hominid glimpsed in remote woods; elusive guardian or beast.

name: Skunk Ape
description: A smaller, pungent cousin of Bigfoot said to haunt mangrove swamps.

name: Wampus Cat
description: A cat featured prowler of southern hills; avenger or monster depending on the tale.

name: Jackalope
description: A jackrabbit with antelope horns born from taxidermy pranks; now a roadside icon.

name: Mothman
description: A glowing eyed flyer linked to the Silver Bridge collapse; omen or protector?

name: Flatwoods Monster
description: Spade headed, hissing figure from a 1952 close encounter; burned into local mythos.

name: Loveland Frogman
description: A human sized frog seen with wand like device near bridges; prank or presence?

name: Dover Demon
description: A spindly, melon headed nocturnal creature seen by teens in 1977; never returned.

name: Jersey Devil
description: The cursed 13th child of Mother Leeds who haunts the Pines with bloodcurdling shrieks.

name: Goatman (Maryland)
description: An axe bearing satyr like terror blamed for pets and lovers’ lane scares.

name: Pope Lick Monster
description: A hypnotic goatman said to lure victims to a fatal bridge; tragic accidents abound.

name: Fresno Nightcrawlers
description: Thin, leg like beings captured on CCTV; spindly walkers of late night lawns.

name: Hodag
description: A spiky backed beast born from lumberjack tall tales; captured in sideshow spirit.

name: Champ
description: A shy serpentine dweller of Champlain; sightings span centuries and two nations.

name: Caddy (Cadborosaurus)
description: A long necked sea creature seen from sail to suburb; named for Cadboro Bay.

name: Ogopogo
description: A traditional n’ha aitk lake guardian turned modern mascot of serpent sightings.

name: Chessie
description: A friendly or fearsome bay serpent depending on the teller; regional Nessie.

name: Manipogo
description: One of Canada’s many ' pogo' lake serpents; shy, sleek, and slippery.

name: Cressie
description: A North Atlantic coil backer seen by fishers; tales survive alongside ice and fog.

name: Momo (Missouri Monster)
description: A shaggy, skunky bigfoot cousin haunting the Mississippi palisades.

name: Tahoe Tessie
description: A deep dwelling serpent of Tahoe’s cold blue; playful or perilous by mood.

name: Batsquatch
description: A giant bat hominid sighted post St. Helens eruption; ash born legend.

name: Headless Nun (Sister Marie)
description: A beheaded nun whose ghost guards buried gold along Acadian trails.

name: Bell Witch
description: A talkative, vengeful spirit who tormented the Bell family—America’s classic haunting.

name: Headless Horseman
description: A Hessian specter seeking his head across Dutch country roads.

name: Chupacabra
description: A modern goat sucker that spread from the Caribbean into continental lore.

name: Slender Man
description: Tall faceless figure born online that bled into real world folklore and moral panic.

name: Bloody Mary
description: Say her name and a bleeding ghost appears—sleepover rite of fear and bravado.

name: Resurrection Mary
description: A ballroom girl who hitches rides home from the grave; archetypal roadside specter.

name: Amaterasu
description: Amaterasu is a deity from Japan (Shinto) associated with sun, light, order.

name: Susanoo
description: Susanoo is a deity from Japan (Shinto) associated with storms, sea, serpent-slayer. Often invoked in tales of tempests and sky-sovereignty. Stories warn that respect for waters and their spirits is essential. Serpentine power signals both wisdom and danger at liminal borders.

name: Tsukuyomi
description: Tsukuyomi is a deity from Japan (Shinto) associated with moon, night.

name: Kitsune
description: Kitsune is a shapeshifter from Japan associated with fox, trickery, magic. Lessons arise from pranks that backfire or expose human folly.

name: Tengu
description: Tengu is a spirit from Japan associated with mountains, war, guardian.

name: Kappa
description: Kappa is a spirit from Japan associated with water, trickery, drowning. Stories warn that respect for waters and their spirits is essential. Lessons arise from pranks that backfire or expose human folly.

name: Oni
description: Oni is a monster from Japan associated with demons, punishment.

name: Tanuki
description: Tanuki is a shapeshifter from Japan associated with trickery, prosperity. Lessons arise from pranks that backfire or expose human folly.

name: Yuki-onna
description: Yuki-onna is a spirit from Japan associated with snow, seduction, winter.

name: Jorogumo
description: Jorogumo is a monster from Japan associated with spider, seduction.

name: Gashadokuro
description: Gashadokuro is a monster from Japan associated with undead, night.

name: Noppera-bō
description: Noppera-bō is a spirit from Japan associated with faceless ghost, fear.

name: Inugami
description: Inugami is a spirit from Japan associated with dog spirit, sorcery.

name: Amanojaku
description: Amanojaku is a spirit from Japan associated with contrarian, possession.

name: Yamata-no-Orochi
description: Yamata-no-Orochi is a monster from Japan (Shinto) associated with serpent, chaos. Serpentine power signals both wisdom and danger at liminal borders.

name: Izanagi
description: Primordial father who, with Izanami, created the islands; later performed misogi purification to restore order.

name: Izanami
description: Primordial mother who died birthing fire; her descent to Yomi links creation to death and taboo.

name: Inari Ōkami
description: Major kami of rice and industry; foxes (kitsune) serve as messengers.

name: Ame-no-Uzume
description: Goddess whose bawdy dance lured Amaterasu from her cave, returning light to the world.

name: Sarutahiko
description: Stout-nosed kami who guides between heavenly and earthly realms; patron of journeys.

name: Raijin
description: Thunder god who beats drums of storm across the sky; often paired with wind god Fujin.

name: Fujin
description: Wild god of wind who carries a great bag of gales, unleashing tempests.

name: Ryūjin
description: Dragon king of the ocean with a palace under the waves; controls tides with magical jewels.

name: Kaguya-hime
description: Moon princess found in a bamboo stalk; returns to the lunar realm leaving earthly suitors behind.

name: Momotarō
description: Peach Boy who gathers animal allies to defeat island ogres; a parable of cooperation and bravery.

name: Urashima Tarō
description: Fisherman who visits the Dragon Palace; returns to find centuries have passed.

name: Shuten-dōji
description: Legendary oni chieftain defeated by Minamoto no Raikō through guile and sacred sake.

name: Nurarihyon
description: Old yokai who slips into homes, acting like the master while servants obey.

name: Rokurokubi
description: By day ordinary women; by night their necks stretch to spy or feed on fear.

name: Nure-onna
description: Serpentine woman who lures travelers near water with a heavy bundle before attacking.

name: Ushi-oni
description: Bull-headed seaside yokai whose poison breath and webs doom fishermen.

name: Bakeneko
description: Cat that grows old and large enough to speak, dance, and curse; sometimes benevolent.

name: Nekomata
description: Elder cat whose tail splits in two; commands the dead and torments cruel owners.

name: Zashiki-warashi
description: Childlike household spirit that brings prosperity to homes that treat it kindly.

name: Kasa-obake
description: One-legged umbrella yokai that hops about startling people; emblem of tsukumogami.

name: Tamamo-no-Mae
description: Beautiful courtesan revealed as a deadly fox spirit; a pan-Asian fox lore node.

name: Aka Manto
description: Aka Manto is a spirit from Japan associated with restroom ghost, death. Serves as a guardian or guide across the boundary of life and death.

name: Akashita
description: Akashita is a spirit from Japan associated with storm clouds, devouring. Tales link them to tempests and sky-sovereignty.

name: Ao Andon
description: Ao Andon is a spirit from Japan associated with lantern ghost, fear. Serves as a guardian or guide across the boundary of life and death.

name: Azukiarai
description: Azukiarai is a spirit from Japan associated with river, bean-washing prank. Appeased with offerings to ensure safe crossings and rain. Stories teach caution through pranks that expose human folly.

name: Baku
description: Baku is a spirit from Japan associated with dream-eater, protection.

name: Betobeto-san
description: Betobeto-san is a spirit from Japan associated with invisible follower, night roads.

name: Binbōgami
description: Binbōgami is a deity/spirit from Japan associated with poverty, household.

name: Byakko
description: Byakko is a creature from Japan/China associated with white tiger, west, autumn.

name: Dodomeki
description: Dodomeki is a monster from Japan associated with hundred-eyed, theft.

name: Enenra
description: Enenra is a spirit from Japan associated with smoke, illusion.

name: Futakuchi-onna
description: Futakuchi-onna is a monster from Japan associated with two-mouthed woman, hunger.

name: Goryō
description: Goryō is a spirit from Japan associated with vengeful noble ghosts, calamity. Serves as a guardian or guide across the boundary of life and death.

name: Hanako-san
description: Hanako-san is a spirit from Japan associated with school restroom ghost, pranks. Serves as a guardian or guide across the boundary of life and death. Stories teach caution through pranks that expose human folly.

name: Hitodama
description: Hitodama is a spirit from Japan associated with will-o'-the-wisp, souls.

name: Hone-onna
description: Hone-onna is a spirit from Japan associated with skeleton woman, deceit.

name: Ittan-momen
description: Ittan-momen is a spirit from Japan associated with flying cloth, suffocation.

name: Jikininki
description: Jikininki is a spirit from Japan associated with corpse-eaters, avarice.

name: Jubokko
description: Jubokko is a monster from Japan associated with vampiric tree, battlefield.

name: Kamaitachi
description: Kamaitachi is a spirit from Japan associated with wind weasel, cuts. Tales link them to tempests and sky-sovereignty.

name: Karakasa-obake
description: Karakasa-obake is a spirit from Japan associated with umbrella yokai, pranks. Stories teach caution through pranks that expose human folly.

name: Kawa-no-kami
description: Kawa-no-kami is a deity/spirit from Japan associated with river, sacrifice. Appeased with offerings to ensure safe crossings and rain.

name: Kawauso
description: Kawauso is a spirit from Japan associated with otter trickster, river. Appeased with offerings to ensure safe crossings and rain. Stories teach caution through pranks that expose human folly.

name: Kiyohime
description: Kiyohime is a spirit from Japan associated with obsessive love, serpent transformation. Serpentine power signifies both protection and peril at liminal places.

name: Komainu
description: Komainu is a creature from Japan associated with guardian lion-dogs, shrines.

name: Konaki-jiji
description: Konaki-jiji is a spirit from Japan associated with weeping old man, weight curse.

name: Konohanasakuya-hime
description: Konohanasakuya-hime is a deity from Japan (Shinto) associated with mount fuji, flowering.

name: Kuebiko
description: Kuebiko is a deity/spirit from Japan associated with scarecrow, wisdom.

name: Kuchisake-onna
description: Kuchisake-onna is a spirit from Japan associated with slit-mouthed woman, urban legend.

name: Mikoshi-nyūdō
description: Mikoshi-nyūdō is a monster from Japan associated with tall monk, startle.

name: Namahage
description: Namahage is a spirit from Japan associated with new year demons, admonition.

name: Nurikabe
description: Nurikabe is a spirit from Japan associated with invisible wall, obstruction.

name: Nuppeppō
description: Nuppeppō is a monster from Japan associated with fleshy lump, odor.

name: Oiwa
description: Oiwa is a spirit from Japan associated with banchō sarayashiki, vengeful ghost. Serves as a guardian or guide across the boundary of life and death.

name: Okiku
description: Okiku is a spirit from Japan associated with well ghost, broken plates. Serves as a guardian or guide across the boundary of life and death.

name: Onryō
description: Onryō is a spirit from Japan associated with vengeful dead, haunting.

name: Otoroshi
description: Otoroshi is a spirit from Japan associated with gate guardian, hairy.

name: Raijū
description: Raijū is a creature from Japan associated with thunder beast, lightning. Tales link them to tempests and sky-sovereignty.

name: Ryōmen Sukuna
description: Ryōmen Sukuna is a deity/spirit from Japan associated with two-faced, ancient hero.

name: Samebito
description: Samebito is a spirit from Japan associated with shark-man, tears of jewels.

name: Sazae-oni
description: Sazae-oni is a monster from Japan associated with sea snail demon, trickster. Appeased with offerings to ensure safe crossings and rain. Stories teach caution through pranks that expose human folly.

name: Shachihoko
description: Shachihoko is a creature from Japan associated with tiger-carp, roof guardian.

name: Shikigami
description: Shikigami is a spirit from Japan associated with summoned familiar, magic.

name: Shirime
description: Shirime is a monster from Japan associated with eye-in-butt, prank. Stories teach caution through pranks that expose human folly.

name: Taira no Masakado
description: Taira no Masakado is a spirit from Japan associated with goryō, capital guardian.

name: Tesso
description: Tesso is a monster from Japan associated with iron rat, temple vengeance.

name: Tsuchigumo
description: Tsuchigumo is a monster from Japan associated with earth spider, rebel.

name: Tsurube-otoshi
description: Tsurube-otoshi is a monster from Japan associated with falling lantern monster.

name: Ubume
description: Ubume is a spirit from Japan associated with ghost mother, childcare. Serves as a guardian or guide across the boundary of life and death.

name: Umi-bōzu
description: Umi-bōzu is a spirit from Japan associated with sea, capsizing ships. Appeased with offerings to ensure safe crossings and rain.

name: Yatagarasu
description: Yatagarasu is a spirit from Japan associated with three-legged crow, guidance.

name: Yosuzume
